content: Hello, @WG-async-foundations! It's time for our weekly triage meeting.
Go ahead and react with a :wave: to show you're here.

We have the usual agenda today:

  • Announcements
  • [eholk] New issue triage
  • Discussion on progress/blockers around sprint bugs
We can go ahead and start with announcements.
I don't have any this week. Does anyone else have something to announce?
Looks like we can move on then
Next up is new issue triage.
We have no new issues! :tada:
So that wraps that up :)
Looks like it may be a quick meeting today.
wg-async meeting, any% speedrun
Our last section is for discussion on sprint bug progress, etc.
I believe we have ~3 days left in our sprint?
Yes! That should have been under announcements. The sprint planning meeting is Thursday.
So I was able to spend some time looking at #78649 last week.

Update from me on my sprint issues: still need to incorporate feedback on my post on "async concurrency" (about select!), hoping to get that published before the next sprint.

I probably will need to let the PR renaming std::stream::Stream to std::async_iter::AsyncIterator slide to next sprint.
I'm planning to spend some time within the next day or two thinking about what we mean by "async and sync code behave the same"

I'm trying to decide how to summarize #78649. Basically, there's a cycle, because to check for auto traits (Send), we need to borrow check, and to borrow check we need to make the MIR, and to generate MIR we have to type check, which includes checking auto traits.

So I need to learn some more about trait selection and borrow checking, but it sounds like we might need a impls_trait_modulo_regions check (thanks to @Daniel Henry-Mantilla for the suggestion!), but we'd need to be careful not to introduce unsoundness with that.
Anyway, that's all I've got for now.
/me shows up late
Anyone else have anything?
the blog post is pending on blog.rust-lang.org

nikomatsakis said:

the blog post is pending on blog.rust-lang.org

which post?
I wrote up something about cancellation, but not surprisingly, the "quick post" turned into a multi-part series :)

Yoshua Wuyts [he/they] said:

which one?

https://github.com/rust-lang/blog.rust-lang.org/pull/921

nikomatsakis said:

I wrote up something about cancellation, but not surprisingly, the "quick post" turned into a multi-part series :)

that said, in writing out my arguments about cancellation and why I was into the idea of more general resumable generators, I realized that I was wrong about a key piece of that :)
(for those whom I was "hinting" to)
anyway, no major updates here beyond that. I've been pretty busy with start of year transition stuff, I'm expecting that to end after this week.
Awesome, thanks for the update!
Okay, if there's nothing else, I think we can go ahead and wrap up.
@triagebot end-meeting

Does anyone have something to bring up?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if you're ready to end the meeting.
I guess the usual emojis are not showing?
Sometimes they're slow, but not usually this slow.
Anyway, thanks everyone!
